009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * This is an implementation of the modified Kåsa [1] circle fitting algorithm described in 
021 * [2, Sec. 5.1]. A description of the concrete algorithm can be found in [3, Alg. 11.1].
022 * See {@link CircleFitKasaA} for the original version.
023 * <p>
024 * Compared to the original Kåsa algorithm, this variant also solves a 3x3 linear
025 * system but uses a slightly different setup of the scatter matrix (using only
026 * powers of 2 instead of 3). A numerical solver is used for this purpose.
027 * The algorithm is fast but shares the same numerical instabilities and bias when 
028 * sample points are taken from a small circle segment.
029 * It fails when matrix M becomes singular.
030 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
031 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
032 * point can be specified).
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * [1] I. Kåsa. "A circle fitting procedure and its error analysis",
036 * <em>IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement</em> <strong>25</strong>(1), 
037 * 8–14 (1976).
038 * <br>
039 * [2] N. Chernov. "Circular and Linear Regression: Fitting Circles and
040 * Lines by Least Squares". Monographs on Statistics and Applied Probability.
041 * Taylor &amp; Francis (2011).
042 * <br>
043 * [3] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
044 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * @author WB
048 * @see CircleFitKasaA
049 * @see CircleFitKasaC
050 *
051 */
052public class CircleFitKasaB implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
053
054        private final double[] q;       // q = (B,C,D) circle parameters, A=1
055        
056        /**
057         * Constructor.
058         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
059         * 
060         * @param points sample points
061         */
062        public CircleFitKasaB(Pnt2d[] points) {
063                this(points, null);
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Constructor.
068         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
069         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
070         * 
071         * @param points sample points
072         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
073         */
074        public CircleFitKasaB(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
075                this.q = fit(points, xref);
076        }
077        
078        
079        @Override
080        public double[] getParameters() {
081                return q;
082        }
083        
084        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
085                final int n = pts.length;
086                if (n < 3) {
087                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
088                }
089                
090                if (xref == null) {
091                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
092                }
093                final double xr = xref.getX();
094                final double yr = xref.getY();
095
096                // calculate elements of scatter matrix
097                double sx = 0, sy = 0, sz = 0;
098                double sxy = 0, sxx = 0, syy = 0, sxz = 0, syz = 0;
099                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
100                        final double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
101                        final double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
102                        final double x2 = sqr(x);
103                        final double y2 = sqr(y);
104                        final double z = x2 + y2;
105                        sx  += x;
106                        sy  += y;
107                        sz  += z;
108                        sxx += x2;
109                        syy += y2;
110                        sxy += x * y;   
111                        sxz += x * z;
112                        syz += y * z;
113                }
114                
115                double[][] X = {                                // scatter matrix X
116                                {sxx, sxy, sx},
117                                {sxy, syy, sy},
118                                { sx,  sy,  n}};
119            
120                double[] b = {-sxz, -syz, -sz};  // RHS vector
121                double[] qq = Matrix.solve(X, b); // solve M * qq = b (exact), for parameter vector qq = (B, C, D)
122                if (qq == null) {
123                        return null;    // M is singular, no solution
124                }
125                else {
126                        // re-adjust for data centering
127                        RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
128                        return M.operate(new double[] {1, qq[0], qq[1], qq[2]});        // q = (A,B,C,D)
129                }
130        }
131
132}
